duties_responsibilities.duty: Execute professional nursing care in accordance with physician treatment plans to provide for the comfort and well-being of patients and their families.
Collect patient health data and perform initial assessments based on patient's presentation.
Incorporate discharge planning into the admission process and analyze assessment data for problem identification.
Develop a family centered plan of care consistent with the assessment of the patient's needs and the physician's treatment plan.
Provide education to the patient and family using the educational assessment and recognize hazards to patient safety.
Evaluate patient progress, document response to interventions, and communicate with the patient, family, and healthcare providers.

Participate in the evaluation of the quality and effectiveness of nursing practices, maintaining effective interactions with the staff, and engaging in performance appraisal and professional development.
Maintain knowledge and proficiency in the clinical area and age group served, complying with staff meeting attendance requirement.

education_certification.credential: Professional knowledge of nursing theory and practice acquired through completion of a two-year training at an accredited School of Nursing (Bachelor's degree in Nursing preferred)
Current New York State license or Permit as a Registered Professional Nurse
Interpersonal skills necessary to effectively interact with patients and their families, demonstrating recognition of cultural diversity
Practice that reflects customer service excellence and clear communication in verbal and written format
Analytical ability to assess and develop solutions to clinical situations or unit problems
ACLS Certification for ICU and Float pool
